Class minimud.Connection 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----java.lang.Thread
           |
           +----minimud.Connection
public class Connection
extends Thread
Handles individual connections to the Minimud (Each connection has its own Connection class)

Version:
1.0
Author:
Tristan Greaves

client
The Socket that belongs to this client
conn
The almighty Controller that overlooks all these
in
Where we receive input from the player's terminal
out
Where we send output to go to the player's terminal
play
The Player class associated with the connection

Connection(Socket, Controller)
Initialize the input and output streams to the socket and start the thread.

diediedie()
Kill any socket connection, and stop the thread
run()
Provide the service to the client.
sendToSocket(byte[], int)
Send the contents of stuff[] to the player's terminal.

client 
 protected Socket client
The Socket that belongs to this client

in 
 protected DataInputStream in
Where we receive input from the player's terminal

out 
 protected PrintStream out
Where we send output to go to the player's terminal

conn 
 protected Controller conn
The almighty Controller that overlooks all these

play 
 public Player play
The Player class associated with the connection

Connection 
 public Connection(Socket client_socket,
                   Controller con)
Initialize the input and output streams to the socket and start the thread.

Parameters:
client_socket - The socket where the new client is.
con - The almighty controller.

sendToSocket 
 public void sendToSocket(byte stuff[],
                          int len)
Send the contents of stuff[] to the player's terminal.

Parameters:
stuff[] - Data to send
len - Length of data to be sent
diediedie 
 public void diediedie()
Kill any socket connection, and stop the thread

run 
 public void run()
Provide the service to the client. Queues stuff for the controller if it needs to deal with anything.

Overrides:
run in class Thread
